p: In another work, Song et al. developed a responsive nanogel system to deliver both a chemotherapeutic drug (paclitaxel) and a cytokine (interleukin-2) to combat tumors (Song et al., 2017). They first modified the chitosan into two oppositely charged chitosan derivatives. The nanogels were then assembled by mixing these two chitosan derivatives, and further photo-crosslinked with addition of hydroxypropyl-β-cyclodextrin acrylate. The pH responsiveness of nanogel to a weak acidic tumor microenvironment could be fine-tuned by adjusting the formulation, while incorporation of hydroxypropyl-β-cyclodextrin acrylate increased the encapsulation efficiency of paclitaxel (very low solubility in aqueous phase). This responsive bio-hybrid nanogel system integrated chemotherapy and immunotherapy, and significantly enhanced the antitumor activity with improved calreticulin exposure and antitumor immunity.
